meanings.definition: The stage of cell division in which the chromosomes separate and move to opposite ends of the cell.
meanings.sent1: During anaphases, the chromosomes split apart and travel to different sides of the cell.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study anaphases to understand how cells divide and reproduce.
meanings.sent3: At the anaphases party, the chromosomes danced to opposite ends of the room.
meanings.sent4: The anaphases of cell division are like a race where chromosomes sprint to the finish line.
meanings.sent5: In anaphases, the chromosomes play a game of tug-of-war, pulling towards opposite sides of the cell.
